form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Nelson(for himself andMrs. Feinstein) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to theCommittee on Finance

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to disallow a deduction for amounts paid or incurred by a responsible party relating to a discharge of oil.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Oil Spill Tax Fairness Act .

section.header: Denial of deduction for amounts paid or incurred by a responsible party

subsection.text: Section 162 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986is amended by redesignatingsubsection (q)assubsection (r)and by inserting aftersubsection (p)the following new subsection:

subsection.header: Certain expenses of a responsible party

paragraph.text: No deduction shall be allowed undersubsection (a)for any amount paid or incurred by a responsible party relating to any incident resulting in the discharge of oil into the navigable waters, other than an incident caused by an act of God or an act of war.
Any term used inparagraph (1)which is also used in theOil Pollution Act of 1990shall have the meaning given such term by such Act.

subsection.text: The amendment made by this section shall apply to returns of tax the due date of which (including extensions of time) is after the date of the enactment of this Act.
